isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - IC BUS SERVICE MANUAL - HEATERS AND ACCESSORIES - MOTORS/SWITCHES/BLOWERS AND FANS

svcproc.title: MOTORS/SWITCHES/BLOWERS AND FANS
svcproc.para: Motors are essentially maintenance free and do not require any lubrication or cleaning. However, excessive vibration caused by damaged blowers, wheels, and fans can cause motor damage. To inspect the motors for vibration, operate each motor one at a time by the control switch and listen for noise
Switches are maintenance free, but can be damaged by water and loose wire connections. Loose wires cause the component to require more amperage than normal. Inspect on a regular basis.

Defroster fans can be mounted on the bulkhead above the driver. The fans should be kept clean of dirt and dust. The metal cage of the fan can be removed for blade cleaning. Bend the metal lock clamps to remove the metal cage.
